page.title: 13Stanmore Industrial Estate
page.content: The land rises steeply from the river valley, up towards the brow of the Hermitage, where it levels off into fields and woodland. The whole of this slope is solid sandstone with a thin layer of fossil embedded mudstone covering it where it has not been worn away. It is along this "Hermitage Hill Coppice", that The Hobbins, a R.A.F.married quarters still stands, the sole reminder of what was once a very large training center. Most of the land has now been turned over to the Stanmore Industrial Estate, a site of numerous small growing industries. The land here is rich and so houses some large farms. With the opening of a new by-pass the present situation is due to change, as new roads bring in more traffic.
